page.title: 14RAF NEWTON
page.content: RAF Newton is one of the only two remaining RAF stations in Nottinghamshire. It is situated at the side of the A46. It was first built in 1936 and was used by Bomber Command during the war. It is now used as a training centre and is the home of the national training school for RAF police dogs. There are dog trials held every summer for the best service dog. For the training of pilots two types of aircraft are used:- the Chipmunk and the Bulldog. There are housing facilities for 200 families on the base. There is a gym and a sports field, a church and various shops. There is a nursery for younger children but older children go to local schools. Also on the base there are 2 social clubs, a youth club, and activities such as scouts, guides and an A.T.C. group.
